result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa S Tyson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, treatment; at the agent's discretion.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Have no contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by the agent.

Any and all treatment as recommended by the agent.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa S Tyson

records.addlTxt: Plea date on March 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Order Denying Defendant's Motion
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bail is hereby denied.

Zoom appearances.
Defendant in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.
Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Attorney McCann argues for lower cash or signature bond.
The State objects to any modification.
Court denies the motion.  State to draft order.
Plea date set for 03-28-22 at 11:30 a.m. Br. 2
Minutes.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bond

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.    
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 03-04-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Order to report to TRPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 4 cts. felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-28-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $20,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with any minors.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
